sourceDesc:
<<<<<<< HEAD
A reply to a paper of Dr. Sandersons, containing a censure of Mr. A.A. his booke Of the confusions and revolutions of goverment [sic] Sanderson, Robert, 1587-1663.
[6], 3-18 p.
Printed by A.J., and are to be sold by T.R., London : 1650.
A reply, not only to Sanderson, but also to Edward Gee's "An exercitation concerning usurped powers", another reply to Antony Ascham's work. Includes "Dr Sandersons paper and censure", beginning: Upon persual [sic] Mr. Ascham's book you left with mee, prelim. p. [3]-[4]. Reproduction of original in Huntington Library.
=======
A reply to a paper of Dr. Sandersons, containing a censure of Mr. A.A. his booke Of the confusions and revolutions of goverment [sic] Sanderson, Robert, 1587-1663.
[6], 3-18 p.
Printed by A.J., and are to be sold by T.R., London : 1650.
A reply, not only to Sanderson, but also to Edward Gee's "An exercitation concerning usurped powers", another reply to Antony Ascham's work. Includes "Dr Sandersons paper and censure", beginning: Upon persual [sic] Mr. Ascham's book you left with mee, prelim. p. [3]-[4]. Reproduction of original in Huntington Library.
T.R.
A.J.
